suffixes.meaning: to do, to be in a certain way (infinitive/root marker)

suffixes.meaning: once it has been done, as soon as it has happened; expresses a completed action and an immediate subsequent action

suffixes.usage: attached to plural nouns to indicate transitive relation with plural object

marks action that occurred days or weeks ago (indefinite past, does not require -ra)

suffixes.meaning: want, desire in the present tense

suffixes.meaning: -ing verb ending (present participial); while doing so, simultaneous action

suffixes.meaning: negation of adjectives or nouns; for verbs: to make an action happen, causative

nashimabanon (will make bathe, with -banon announcement tense)

suffixes.meaning: definite past tense - many years ago

suffixes.usage: Emphasizes the specific action itself

suffixes.meaning: once I have done; expresses a completed action and a not so immediate subsequent action
suffixes.usage: Goes right after the root of a transitive verb; requires other suffixes (tenses, commands) to follow; requires a transitive pronoun (en, min, jan, etc.) before it; makes all verbs transitive in nature
examples: axonai (I do it for another, present)

suffixes.usage: comitative suffix expressing accompaniment or possession of a quality

attached to verb stems, followed by tense markers

suffixes.meaning: to do something fully or to completion

Paoyonribataana (having fully put on the belt)

suffixes.usage: concessive suffix marking subordinate clauses expressing contrast
examples: onisyona ikenbi (even though I became fully saddened)
paxkinyona ikenbi (even though I became fully tired)
paxnayona ikenbi (even though I became fully exhausted)
yosmayona ikenbi (even though I became fully weakened)

suffixes.meaning: to perform an action fully, to completion

suffixes.usage: verbal suffix
